author: pdobacz
content: Thanks for reporting, does this fix it? https://github.com/ipsilon/eof/pull/89/commits/9a40aaaa9936c7bf89774e1722663f1894c30530

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
It does explain it a bit more, next question :D
> execute the container in "initcode-mode" and deduct gas for execution
Does this mean we give the initcode a stipend of all available gas or are we still doing the 63/64 rule?

author: chfast
content: The 63/64 rules is kept unchanged.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Is EIP150 applied before or after the hashing charge?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: (after would be consistent with the other create instructions)

author: chfast
content: Generally this follows CREATE2 workflow.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Are we still checking MaxInitCodeSize?

author: pdobacz
content: EIP150 or EIP170 (max code size)?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: well both

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I see that 170 is applied after deploying?

author: pdobacz
content:
Re EIP170/3860 the answer is
- max code size is checked in EOFCREATE flow spec (same applies to TXCREATE): "if updated deploy container size exceeds `MAX_CODE_SIZE` instruction exceptionally aborts". After hshing charge, just before deploying
- max initcode size is checked as part of transaction validation (for InitcodeTransactions)

author: pdobacz
content: And if by EIP150 you mean the 63/64 rule, after hashing

author: chfast
content: Is there any tool to dump a testnet/mainnet transaction? E.g. generate a state test file with prestate and the given transaction?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Next question: in order to check which initcode to use, I need to hash all initcodes of a transaction, right?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Are these costs reflected in the opcode or is the implementation supposed to hash them before calling into the evm?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: What happens if the initcodes array contains an empty element and we query it with keccak([]byte{})? Should we start the creation process regardless or do we return 0 on the stack same as if the initcode was not found

author: danceratopz
content:
<@393119312350543872> added a script to create a blockchain test EEST filler (python):
https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/blob/3a6520e9411748ef33e6d072d639c6bea70998d6/src/cli/gentest.py

author: pdobacz
content: Correct. (for others reading - this applies to InitcodeTransaction and TXCREATE being used in EOF)

author: pdobacz
content: Not sure about the latter part (when hash). Re the cost, charging extra for all `initcodes` was considered, but I think dropped from the design, because the calldata cost charged is much higher anyway

author: pdobacz
content: empty elements are invalid under tx validation rules ("invalid if (...) any entry in initcodes has zero length"). This is a more recent addition, not yet merged into the EIP, only in the Megaspec doc

content: how can i change my http cors to global, from local host ?

author: chfast
content: This is nice. Can someone actually dump some transactions for me?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: What are the rules for the immediates for dupN, swapN regarding overflows of the immediate?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Can someone point me to the eip for the exchange instruction, seems a bit unnecessary to me

author: chfast
content: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-663

author: chfast
content: runtime overflow?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: we read an 8bit immediate and add 1 to it, should that overflow, or do we cast it to a bigger type before adding 1

author: chfast
content: you should use bigger type to get 256.

author: _shemnon
content: Exchange was an explicit request from a compiler team.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Why not make exchange take two immediates and get rid of swapN?

author: _shemnon
content: One less byte.  A code analysis seemed to show 17 and limited acces to 32 covers 80%

author: _shemnon
content: Here's a quick document summarizing my opinions on the relative importance of each EOF feature.  Spoiler alert: it's top heavy. https://hackmd.io/@shemnon/mega-eof-scoping

author: _shemnon
content: The EOF call has knelt to the power of Daylight Saving Time and moved their weekly call back an hour to 1500GMT Wednesday (tomorrow/today). If you have burning questions about EOF (such as Prague scope, tweaking specs, etc) this is the right call to be on.  https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1014
